Despite participating in training the previous day, Mbappe was not included in Didier Deschamps' starting lineup for the game, even with a mask bearing the French colors.

Prior to the match, Griezmann, another French football player, voiced his disappointment over Mbappe's absence during interviews. He highlighted the importance of adaptability for the squad, stating, "Mbappe is one of the world's top players. Our offensive strategies are significantly influenced by his presence or absence. Our team's strength is rooted in our ability to adjust."

Unfortunately, Mbappe donned a plain mask during team preparations to adhere to Uefa regulations rather than the decorative one he wore during training. Regardless, he did not take the field, with Griezmann and Thuram chosen to spearhead the attack instead.

27.0_en:
A couple were taken to hospital after they were recovered from the water

A man has died after his car entered water during Storm Bert. The man, aged in his 80s, was recovered by emergency services from water on Cockhill Lane, Foulridge, Colne, where Noyna Ford is located, at about 16:15 GMT on Saturday, Lancashire Police said. He was taken to hospital where he was pronounced dead. A woman, aged in her 80s, was also recovered from the water and remains in hospital where her condition is described as not life threatening.

Lancashire Fire and Rescue Service sent two fire engines to the scene. Firefighters from Nelson and Penwortham who are specialist swift water rescue teams were involved along with a boat from Preston. The man’s death is not being treated as suspicious and a file will be passed to the coroner, police said. Homes and roads have seen some flooding across the UK during heavy rain, particularly in Wales, with more than 100 flood warnings in place across Britain.
• None Body found in search for man missing during Storm Bert
27.1_en:
A man in his 80s lost his life after his vehicle ended up in the water during Storm Bert on Cockhill Lane, Foulridge, Colne, near Noyna Ford, at approximately 16:15 GMT on Saturday. He was retrieved by emergency services and transported to the hospital where he was later declared dead. A woman of similar age was rescued from the water and her condition is reported as not critical.

Two fire engines from Lancashire Fire and Rescue Service were dispatched to the incident. Firefighters from Nelson and Penwortham, who specialize in swift water rescues, participated, along with a boat from Preston. The man's death is not considered suspicious, and the case will be handed over to the coroner, according to the police. Flooding has affected several homes and roads throughout the UK due to heavy rain, with over 100 flood warnings issued nationwide.

No body was found during the search for a man who went missing during Storm Bert.

Two fire engines from Lancashire Fire and Rescue Service were sent to the scene, with firefighters from Nelson and Penwortham, who are trained in swift water rescues, and a boat from Preston joining the effort. The man's death is not being treated as suspicious, and the police have indicated that the case will be passed on to the coroner.

Despite prompt medical attention, efforts to revive him were unsuccessful. A woman of similar age was rescued from the scene and her condition is reported as steady.

Two fire engines from Lancashire Fire and Rescue Service, search parties from Nelson and Penwortham, and a boat from Preston were called to the scene. The man's death is not considered suspicious, and the investigation is expected to be handed over to the coroner.

The UK has experienced heavy rainfall resulting in numerous properties and roads being impacted by flooding. Over 100 flood warnings have been issued across the country. Regrettably, despite extensive search efforts during the storm, no trace of a missing man was discovered.

27.49_en:
At approximately 16:15 GMT on a Saturday, an elderly man met with a fatal accident on Cockhill Lane, Foulridge, near Noyna Ford. His vehicle was engulfed in floodwaters caused by Storm Bert, and despite valiant attempts by emergency responders to resuscitate him, they unfortunately were unable to revive him.

Two fire engines from Lancashire Fire and Rescue Service, search teams from Nelson and Penwortham, and a boat from Preston were swiftly dispatched to the scene. It is believed that the old man's death was not the result of any criminal activity, and the case will be handed over to the coroner.

Around 16:15 GMT on a Saturday, an elderly man suffered a fatal accident on Cockhill Lane, Foulridge, close to Noyna Ford. His car was submerged in floodwaters caused by Storm Bert, and despite the heroic efforts of emergency responders to revive him, they regrettably could not.

Two fire engines from Lancashire Fire and Rescue Service, search teams from Nelson and Penwortham, and a boat from Preston were called to the scene. Preliminary reports indicate that the old man's death was not related to any criminal act, and the case will be transferred to the coroner for further investigation.

28.0_en:
Manchester City have signed Japan goalkeeper Ayaka Yamashita on a three-year deal from INAC Kobe.

It is the first time the 28-year-old has joined a club from outside her home country.

Yamashita said she is "very hungry" and looking forward to the challenge of playing in England's top flight.

"I've won various trophies in Asia, but to level up myself I felt the need to take on a challenge," she added.

"It's a famous club that everyone knows, and even now, it feels unbelievable to me."

Yamashita, who played with City midfielder Yui Hasegawa at Tokyo Verdy, has featured 74 times for her country and has won 17 major honours during her career.

She is the Women's Super League club's third Japanese signing of the transfer window following the arrivals of Risa Shimizu from West Ham United and Aoba Fujino from Tokyo Verdy.
28.1_en:
Manchester's City new signing, Ayaka Yamashita from INAC Kobe, expressed her excitement about joining a foreign club for the first time in her career. The 28-year-old Japanese goalkeeper is eager to tackle the challenge of competing in the English Women's Super League.

Yamashita shared her motivation for the move, stating, "I've accumulated numerous accolades in Asia, but to further advance myself, I felt the necessity to confront a new challenge."

City, a renowned club, continues to leave her in awe, as she expressed, "It's a well-known team, and even now, it feels surreal to me."

Yamashita, who previously played alongside City's midfielder Yui Hasegawa at Tokyo Verdy, has donned the Japanese national team jersey 74 times and amassed a total of 17 major titles throughout her career.

Manchester City's Women's Super League squad has recently welcomed two more Japanese players: Risa Shimizu from West Ham United and Aoba Fujino from Tokyo Verdy.
28.2_en:
Ayaka Yamashita, the latest addition to Manchester City's Women's Squad from INAC Kobe, voiced her thrill at making her first career move to a foreign team. The 28-year-old Japanese goalkeeper is eager to face the English Women's Super League's competition.

Yamashita explained her reasoning for the transfer, "Despite earning numerous accolades in Asia, I recognized the need to take on a fresh challenge to progress further in my career."

City, a globally recognized club, continues to impress Yamashita, as she put it, "This team is renowned, and I still find it hard to believe that I am now a part of it."

Yamashita, who previously teamed up with City's midfielder Yui Hasegawa at Tokyo Verdy, has represented Japan's national team 74 times and accumulated a total of 17 major titles throughout her career.

Manchester City's Women's Super League team has recently welcomed two more Japanese players: Risa Shimizu from West Ham United and Aoba Fujino from Tokyo Verdy.

Yamashita and midfielder Yui Hasegawa, another Japanese player, share a professional history, having previously played together at Tokyo Verdy. Manchester City's roster for the Women's Super League has been strengthened with the addition of Risa Shimizu, a former West Ham United player, and Aoba Fujino, who hails from Tokyo Verdy.
28.97_en:

Yamashita and midfielder Yui Hasegawa, another Japanese player, share a professional background, having previously played together at Tokyo Verdy. Manchester City's Women's Super League squad has been bolstered with the arrival of Risa Shimizu, a former West Ham United player, and Aoba Fujino, who comes from Tokyo Verdy.
28.98_en:
Manchester's Women's Team in England's Super League has announced the signing of Japanese goalkeeper Ayaka Yamashita, who brings with her an impressive international resume of 74 caps and 17 major awards. Yamashita's decision to join Manchester City was reportedly influenced by the team's storied past.

Yamashita and midfielder Yui Hasegawa, another Japanese player, share a professional history, having previously played together at Tokyo Verdy. Manchester City's Women's Super League squad has recently strengthened with the addition of Risa Shimizu, a former West Ham United player, and Aoba Fujino, a transferee from Tokyo Verdy.
28.99_en:
Manchester City's Women's Team in England's Super League has secured the signing of Japanese goalkeeper Ayaka Yamashita, boasting an impressive international career with 74 caps and 17 major awards. The allure of Manchester City's storied past reportedly influenced Yamashita's decision to join.

Yamashita and midfielder Yui Hasegawa, a fellow Japanese player, share a professional background, having previously played together at Tokyo Verdy. Manchester City's Women's Super League squad has been bolstered with the arrival of Risa Shimizu, a former West Ham United player, and Aoba Fujino, who has transferred from Tokyo Verdy.
28.100_en:
Manchester City's Women's Team in England's Super League has secured the acquisition of Japanese goalkeeper Ayaka Yamashita, boasting an impressive international resume with 74 caps and 17 major accolades. The rich history of Manchester City reportedly played a role in Yamashita's decision to join.

Yamashita and midfielder Yui Hasegawa, another Japanese player, share a professional past, as they previously played together at Tokyo Verdy. Manchester City's Women's Super League roster has been strengthened with the addition of Risa Shimizu, a former West Ham United player, and Aoba Fujino, who has moved from Tokyo Verdy.

29.0_en:
Police have released dramatic footage of officers ramming a scooter rider following a high-speed pursuit.

The dashcam footage shows the Hampshire police vehicle pursuing a black Honda 125cc scooter at speeds of 60mph in a 30mph limit on The Avenue, Southampton.

The 23-year-old rider, who was carrying a pillion passenger, was forced off the bike near The Common where he then fled.

He was arrested a short distance away and was found in possession of cannabis.

After being convicted in court, the rider was fined, given a suspended jail term, and banned from the road for three months.

29.1_en:
A scooter rider, age 23, was pursued by Hampshire police at approximately 60mph on The Avenue in Southampton, despite the speed limit being 30mph. The incident was captured on the police vehicle's dashcam. The rider, who had a passenger, was eventually forced to dismount near The Common, where he then attempted to escape on foot. He was apprehended a short distance away and was found to be in possession of cannabis. Following a court hearing, the rider was fined, given a suspended prison sentence, and prohibited from driving for three months.

Stay updated with BBC South on Facebook, Twitter, or Instagram. Share your story suggestions with south.newsonline@bbc.co.uk.
29.2_en: A 23-year-old scooter rider, accompanied by a passenger, was chased by Hampshire police at around 60mph on The Avenue in Southampton, despite the posted speed limit of 30mph. This pursuit was recorded on the law enforcement vehicle's dashboard camera. The rider was eventually compelled to dismount near The Common, where he attempted to flee on foot. He was subsequently captured a brief distance away and discovered to have cannabis in his possession. Following a trial, the rider received a fine, a suspended prison sentence, and a driving ban lasting three months.
